014package org.jdbi.v3.testing;
015
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.Arrays;
018import java.util.List;
019
020/**
021 * Represents a Flyway migration Jdbi should run.
022 */
023public class Migration {
024
025    final List<String> schemas = new ArrayList<>();
026    final List<String> paths = new ArrayList<>();
027    boolean cleanAfter = true;
028
029    /**
030     * Use Default {@code db/migration} Flyway schema migration location.
031     * Migration scripts must be on the classpath.
032     */
033    public Migration withDefaultPath() {
034        this.paths.add("db/migration");
035        return this;
036    }
037
038    /**
039     * Add flyway migration path.
040     */
041    public Migration withPath(final String migrationPath) {
042        this.paths.add(migrationPath);
043        return this;
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * Add flyway migration paths.
048     */
049    public Migration withPaths(final String... migrationPaths) {
050        this.paths.addAll(Arrays.asList(migrationPaths));
051        return this;
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * Add flyway migration schema.
056     */
057    public Migration withSchema(final String schema) {
058        this.schemas.add(schema);
059        return this;
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Add flyway migration schemas.
064     */
065    public Migration withSchemas(final String... moreSchemas) {
066        this.schemas.addAll(Arrays.asList(moreSchemas));
067        return this;
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * Will drop all objects in the configured schemas after tests using Flyway.
072     */
073    public Migration cleanAfter() {
074        this.cleanAfter = true;
075        return this;
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Create new Migration.
080     */
081    public static Migration before() {
082        return new Migration();
083    }
084
085}
